meanings.definition: A device used to measure the density of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The densitometer helped the scientist determine how thick the liquid was.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used the densitometer to check the density of the soil sample.
meanings.sent3: The densitometer decided the juice was too thick to drink, so it went on a diet.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a densitometer, scanning the crowd for any signs of movement.
meanings.sent5: The densitometer beeped loudly as it analyzed the density of the rock.

meanings.definition: An instrument that measures the optical density of a photographic image.
meanings.sent1: The photographer relied on the densitometer to ensure the perfect exposure of the film.
meanings.sent2: Using the densitometer, the technician adjusted the contrast of the photograph.
meanings.sent3: The densitometer joked with the camera, saying, 'I can see right through you!'
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a densitometer, capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The densitometer hummed softly as it analyzed the darkness of the picture.
